src/queries/term-level-queries/range-query.js

Less-than

lt(val: (string | number)): RangeQuery
Parameters
val ((string | number))
Returns
RangeQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ from(val)
src/queries/term-level-queries/range-query.js

The lower bound. Defaults to start from the first.

from(val: (string | number)): RangeQuery
Parameters
val ((string | number)) The lower bound value, type depends on field type
Returns
RangeQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ to(val)
src/queries/term-level-queries/range-query.js

The upper bound. Defaults to unbounded.

to(val: (string | number)): RangeQuery
Parameters
val ((string | number)) The upper bound value, type depends on field type
Returns
RangeQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ includeLower(enable)
src/queries/term-level-queries/range-query.js

Should the first from (if set) be inclusive or not. Defaults to true

includeLower(enable: boolean): RangeQuery
Parameters
enable (boolean) true to include, false to exclude
Returns
RangeQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ includeUpper(enable)
src/queries/term-level-queries/range-query.js

Should the last to (if set) be inclusive or not. Defaults to true.

includeUpper(enable: boolean): RangeQuery
Parameters
enable (boolean) true to include, false to exclude
Returns
RangeQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ timeZone(zone)
src/queries/term-level-queries/range-query.js

Time Zone to be applied to any range query related to dates.

timeZone(zone: string): RangeQuery
Parameters
zone (string)
Returns
RangeQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ format(fmt)
src/queries/term-level-queries/range-query.js

Sets the format expression for parsing the upper and lower bounds. If no format is specified, then it will use the first format specified in the field mapping.

format(fmt: string): RangeQuery
Parameters
fmt (string) Format for parsing upper and lower bounds.
Returns
RangeQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained
Example
const qry = esb.rangeQuery('born')
    .gte('01/01/2012')
    .lte('2013')
    .format('dd/MM/yyyy||yyyy');
▸ relation(relation)
src/queries/term-level-queries/range-query.js

Sets the relationship between Query and indexed data that will be used to determine if a Document should be matched or not.

relation(relation: string): RangeQuery
Parameters
relation (string) Can be one of WITHIN , CONTAINS , DISJOINT or INTERSECTS (default)
Returns
RangeQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ toJSON()
src/queries/term-level-queries/range-query.js

Override default toJSON to return DSL representation of the range query class instance.

toJSON(): Object
Returns
Object: returns an Object which maps to the elasticsearch query DSL

ExistsQuery

src/queries/term-level-queries/exists-query.js

Returns documents that have at least one non-null value in the original field

Elasticsearch reference

new ExistsQuery(field: string?)

Extends Query

Parameters
field (string?)
Example
const qry = esb.existsQuery('user');
const qry = esb.boolQuery().mustNot(esb.existsQuery('user'));
Instance Members
▸ field(field)
src/queries/term-level-queries/exists-query.js

Sets the field to search on.

field(field: string): ExistsQuery
Parameters
field (string)
Returns
ExistsQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.

PrefixQuery

src/queries/term-level-queries/prefix-query.js

Matches documents that have fields containing terms with a specified prefix (not analyzed).

Elasticsearch reference

new PrefixQuery(field: string?, value: (string | number)?)

Extends MultiTermQueryBase

Parameters
field (string?)
value ((string | number)?)
Example
const qry = esb.prefixQuery('user', 'ki').boost(2.0);
Instance Members
▸ rewrite(method)
src/queries/term-level-queries/prefix-query.js

Sets the rewrite method. Valid values are:

  • constant_score - tries to pick the best constant-score rewrite method based on term and document counts from the query. Synonyms - constant_score_auto, constant_score_filter

  • scoring_boolean - translates each term into boolean should and keeps the scores as computed by the query

  • constant_score_boolean - same as scoring_boolean, expect no scores are computed.

  • constant_score_filter - first creates a private Filter, by visiting each term in sequence and marking all docs for that term

  • top_terms_boost_N - first translates each term into boolean should and scores are only computed as the boost using the top N scoring terms. Replace N with an integer value.

  • top_terms_N - first translates each term into boolean should and keeps the scores as computed by the query. Only the top N scoring terms are used. Replace N with an integer value.

Default is constant_score.

This is an advanced option, use with care.

Note: The deprecated multi term rewrite parameters constant_score_auto, constant_score_filter (synonyms for constant_score) have been removed in elasticsearch 6.0.

rewrite(method: string): PrefixQuery
Parameters
method (string) The rewrite method as a string.
Returns
PrefixQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Throws
  • Error: If the given rewrite method is not valid.

WildcardQuery

src/queries/term-level-queries/wildcard-query.js

Matches documents that have fields matching a wildcard expression (not analyzed).

Elasticsearch reference

new WildcardQuery(field: string?, value: string?)

Extends MultiTermQueryBase

Parameters
field (string?)
value (string?)
Example
const qry = esb.wildcardQuery('user', 'ki*y').boost(2.0);
Instance Members
▸ caseInsensitive(caseInsensitive)
src/queries/term-level-queries/wildcard-query.js

Allow case insensitive matching or not (added in 7.10.0). Defaults to false.

caseInsensitive(caseInsensitive: boolean): RegexpQuery
Parameters
caseInsensitive (boolean)
Returns
RegexpQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Example
const qry = esb.wildcardQuery('user', 'ki*y')
    .caseInsensitive(true);
▸ rewrite(method)
src/queries/term-level-queries/wildcard-query.js

Sets the rewrite method. Valid values are:

  • constant_score - tries to pick the best constant-score rewrite method based on term and document counts from the query. Synonyms - constant_score_auto, constant_score_filter

  • scoring_boolean - translates each term into boolean should and keeps the scores as computed by the query

  • constant_score_boolean - same as scoring_boolean, expect no scores are computed.

  • constant_score_filter - first creates a private Filter, by visiting each term in sequence and marking all docs for that term

  • top_terms_boost_N - first translates each term into boolean should and scores are only computed as the boost using the top N scoring terms. Replace N with an integer value.

  • top_terms_N - first translates each term into boolean should and keeps the scores as computed by the query. Only the top N scoring terms are used. Replace N with an integer value.

Default is constant_score.

This is an advanced option, use with care.

Note: The deprecated multi term rewrite parameters constant_score_auto, constant_score_filter (synonyms for constant_score) have been removed in elasticsearch 6.0.

rewrite(method: string): WildcardQuery
Parameters
method (string) The rewrite method as a string.
Returns
WildcardQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Throws
  • Error: If the given rewrite method is not valid.

RegexpQuery

src/queries/term-level-queries/regexp-query.js

Query for regular expression term queries. Elasticsearch will apply the regexp to the terms produced by the tokenizer for that field, and not to the original text of the field.

Elasticsearch reference

new RegexpQuery(field: string?, value: (string | number)?)

Extends MultiTermQueryBase

Parameters
field (string?)
value ((string | number)?)
Example
const qry = esb.regexpQuery('name.first', 's.*y').boost(1.2);
Instance Members
▸ flags(flags)
src/queries/term-level-queries/regexp-query.js

Set special flags. Possible flags are ALL (default), ANYSTRING, COMPLEMENT, EMPTY, INTERSECTION, INTERVAL, or NONE.

flags(flags: string): RegexpQuery
Parameters
flags (string) | separated flags. Possible flags are ALL (default), ANYSTRING , COMPLEMENT , EMPTY , INTERSECTION , INTERVAL , or NONE .
Returns
RegexpQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Example
const qry = esb.regexpQuery('name.first', 's.*y')
    .flags('INTERSECTION|COMPLEMENT|EMPTY');
▸ caseInsensitive(caseInsensitive)
src/queries/term-level-queries/regexp-query.js

Allow case insensitive matching or not (added in 7.10.0). Defaults to false.

caseInsensitive(caseInsensitive: boolean): RegexpQuery
Parameters
caseInsensitive (boolean)
Returns
RegexpQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Example
const qry = esb.regexpQuery('name.first', 's.*y')
    .caseInsensitive(true);
▸ maxDeterminizedStates(limit)
src/queries/term-level-queries/regexp-query.js

Limit on how many automaton states regexp queries are allowed to create. This protects against too-difficult (e.g. exponentially hard) regexps. Defaults to 10000.

maxDeterminizedStates(limit: number): RegexpQuery
Parameters
limit (number)
Returns
RegexpQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Example
const qry = esb.regexpQuery('name.first', 's.*y')
    .flags('INTERSECTION|COMPLEMENT|EMPTY')
    .maxDeterminizedStates(20000);
▸ rewrite(method)
src/queries/term-level-queries/regexp-query.js

Sets the rewrite method. Valid values are:

  • constant_score - tries to pick the best constant-score rewrite method based on term and document counts from the query. Synonyms - constant_score_auto, constant_score_filter

  • scoring_boolean - translates each term into boolean should and keeps the scores as computed by the query

  • constant_score_boolean - same as scoring_boolean, expect no scores are computed.

  • constant_score_filter - first creates a private Filter, by visiting each term in sequence and marking all docs for that term

  • top_terms_boost_N - first translates each term into boolean should and scores are only computed as the boost using the top N scoring terms. Replace N with an integer value.

  • top_terms_N - first translates each term into boolean should and keeps the scores as computed by the query. Only the top N scoring terms are used. Replace N with an integer value.

Default is constant_score.

This is an advanced option, use with care.

Note: The deprecated multi term rewrite parameters constant_score_auto, constant_score_filter (synonyms for constant_score) have been removed in elasticsearch 6.0.

rewrite(method: string): RegexpQuery
Parameters
method (string) The rewrite method as a string.
Returns
RegexpQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Throws
  • Error: If the given rewrite method is not valid.

FuzzyQuery

src/queries/term-level-queries/fuzzy-query.js

The fuzzy query generates all possible matching terms that are within the maximum edit distance specified in fuzziness and then checks the term dictionary to find out which of those generated terms actually exist in the index.

The fuzzy query uses similarity based on Levenshtein edit distance.

Elasticsearch reference

new FuzzyQuery(field: string?, value: (string | number)?)

Extends MultiTermQueryBase

Parameters
field (string?)
value ((string | number)?)
Example
const qry = esb.fuzzyQuery('user', 'ki');
// More advanced settings
const qry = esb.fuzzyQuery('user', 'ki')
    .fuzziness(2)
    .prefixLength(0)
    .maxExpansions(100)
    .boost(1.0);
Instance Members
▸ fuzziness(factor)
src/queries/term-level-queries/fuzzy-query.js

Sets the fuzziness parameter which is interpreted as a Levenshtein Edit Distance — the number of one character changes that need to be made to one string to make it the same as another string.

fuzziness(factor: (number | string)): FuzzyQuery
Parameters
factor ((number | string)) Can be specified either as a number, or the maximum number of edits, or as AUTO which generates an edit distance based on the length of the term.
Returns
FuzzyQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ prefixLength(len)
src/queries/term-level-queries/fuzzy-query.js

The number of initial characters which will not be “fuzzified”. This helps to reduce the number of terms which must be examined. Defaults to 0.

prefixLength(len: number): FuzzyQuery
Parameters
len (number) Characters to skip fuzzy for. Defaults to 0 .
Returns
FuzzyQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ maxExpansions(limit)
src/queries/term-level-queries/fuzzy-query.js

The maximum number of terms that the fuzzy query will expand to. Defaults to 50.

maxExpansions(limit: number): FuzzyQuery
Parameters
limit (number) Limit for fuzzy query expansion. Defaults to 50 .
Returns
FuzzyQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ transpositions(enable)
src/queries/term-level-queries/fuzzy-query.js

Transpositions (ab → ba) are allowed by default but can be disabled by setting transpositions to false.

transpositions(enable: boolean): FuzzyQuery
Parameters
enable (boolean)
Returns
FuzzyQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.

IdsQuery

src/queries/term-level-queries/ids-query.js

Filters documents that only have the provided ids. Note, this query uses the _uid field.

Sets the elasticsearch doc type to query on. The type is optional and can be omitted, and can also accept an array of values. If no type is specified, all types defined in the index mapping are tried.

type(type: (Array<string> | string)): IdsQuery
Parameters

Returns
IdsQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.

Compound Queries

Compound Queries

ConstantScoreQuery

src/queries/compound-queries/constant-score-query.js

A query that wraps another query and simply returns a constant score equal to the query boost for every document in the filter. Maps to Lucene ConstantScoreQuery.

Constructs a query where each documents returned by the internal query or filter have a constant score equal to the boost factor.

Elasticsearch reference

new ConstantScoreQuery(filterQuery: Query?)

Extends Query

Parameters
filterQuery (Query?) Query to filter on.
Example
const qry = esb.constantScoreQuery(esb.termQuery('user', 'kimchy')).boost(1.2);
Instance Members
▸ filter(filterQuery)
src/queries/compound-queries/constant-score-query.js

Adds the query to apply a constant score to.

filter(filterQuery: Query): ConstantScoreQuery
Parameters
filterQuery (Query) Query to filter on.
Returns
ConstantScoreQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ query(filterQuery)
src/queries/compound-queries/constant-score-query.js

Adds the query to apply a constant score to. Alias for method filter.

Note: This parameter has been removed in elasticsearch 6.0. Use filter instead.

query(filterQuery: Query): ConstantScoreQuery
Parameters
filterQuery (Query) Query to filter on.
Returns
ConstantScoreQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.

BoolQuery

src/queries/compound-queries/bool-query.js

A query that matches documents matching boolean combinations of other queries. The bool query maps to Lucene BooleanQuery. It is built using one or more boolean clauses, each clause with a typed occurrence.

Elasticsearch reference

new BoolQuery()

Extends Query

Example
const qry = esb.boolQuery()
    .must(esb.termQuery('user', 'kimchy'))
    .filter(esb.termQuery('tag', 'tech'))
    .mustNot(esb.rangeQuery('age').gte(10).lte(20))
    .should([
        esb.termQuery('tag', 'wow'),
        esb.termQuery('tag', 'elasticsearch')
    ])
    .minimumShouldMatch(1)
    .boost(1.0);
Instance Members
▸ must(queries)
src/queries/compound-queries/bool-query.js

Adds must query to boolean container. The clause (query) must appear in matching documents and will contribute to the score.

must(queries: (Array<Query> | Query)): BoolQuery
Parameters
queries ((Array<Query> | Query)) List of valid Query objects or a Query object
Returns
BoolQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Throws
  • TypeError: If Array item or query is not an instance of Query
▸ filter(queries)
src/queries/compound-queries/bool-query.js

Adds filter query to boolean container. The clause (query) must appear in matching documents. However unlike must the score of the query will be ignored. Filter clauses are executed in filter context, meaning that scoring is ignored and clauses are considered for caching.

filter(queries: (Array<Query> | Query)): BoolQuery
Parameters
queries ((Array<Query> | Query)) List of valid Query objects or a Query object
Returns
BoolQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Throws
  • TypeError: If Array item or query is not an instance of Query
Example
// Assign score of `0` to all documents
const qry = esb.boolQuery().filter(esb.termQuery('status', 'active'));

// Assign a score of `1.0` to all documents
const qry = esb.boolQuery()
    .must(esb.matchAllQuery())
    .filter(esb.termQuery('status', 'active'));
▸ mustNot(queries)
src/queries/compound-queries/bool-query.js

Adds must_not query to boolean container. The clause (query) must not appear in the matching documents. Clauses are executed in filter context meaning that scoring is ignored and clauses are considered for caching. Because scoring is ignored, a score of 0 for all documents is returned.

mustNot(queries: (Array<Query> | Query)): BoolQuery
Parameters
queries ((Array<Query> | Query)) List of valid Query objects or a Query object
Returns
BoolQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Throws
  • TypeError: If Array item or query is not an instance of Query
▸ should(queries)
src/queries/compound-queries/bool-query.js

Adds should query to boolean container. The clause (query) should appear in the matching document. In a boolean query with no must or filter clauses, one or more should clauses must match a document. The minimum number of should clauses to match can be set using the minimum_should_match parameter.

should(queries: (Array<Query> | Query)): BoolQuery
Parameters
queries ((Array<Query> | Query)) List of valid Query objects or a Query object
Returns
BoolQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Throws
  • TypeError: If Array item or query is not an instance of Query
▸ disableCoord(enable)
src/queries/compound-queries/bool-query.js

Enables or disables similarity coordinate scoring of documents commoning the CommonTermsQuery. Default: false.

NOTE: This has been removed in elasticsearch 6.0. If provided, it will be ignored and a deprecation warning will be issued.

disableCoord(enable: boolean): BoolQuery
Parameters
enable (boolean)
Returns
BoolQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ minimumShouldMatch(minimumShouldMatch)
src/queries/compound-queries/bool-query.js

Sets the value controlling how many should clauses in the boolean query should match. It can be an absolute value (2), a percentage (30%) or a combination of both. By default no optional clauses are necessary for a match. However, if the bool query is used in a filter context and it has should clauses then, at least one should clause is required to match.

minimumShouldMatch(minimumShouldMatch: (string | number)): BoolQuery
Parameters
minimumShouldMatch ((string | number)) An absolute value (2), a percentage (30%) or a combination of both.
Returns
BoolQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ adjustPureNegative(enable)
src/queries/compound-queries/bool-query.js

Sets if the Query should be enhanced with a MatchAllQuery in order to act as a pure exclude when only negative (mustNot) clauses exist. Default: true.

adjustPureNegative(enable: boolean): BoolQuery
Parameters
enable (boolean)
Returns
BoolQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ toJSON()
src/queries/compound-queries/bool-query.js

Override default toJSON to return DSL representation of the bool compound query class instance.

toJSON(): Object
Returns
Object: returns an Object which maps to the elasticsearch query DSL

DisMaxQuery

src/queries/compound-queries/dis-max-query.js

A query that generates the union of documents produced by its subqueries, and that scores each document with the maximum score for that document as produced by any subquery, plus a tie breaking increment for any additional matching subqueries.

Elasticsearch reference

new DisMaxQuery()

Extends Query

Example
const qry = esb.disMaxQuery()
    .queries([esb.termQuery('age', 34), esb.termQuery('age', 35)])
    .tieBreaker(0.7)
    .boost(1.2);
const qry = esb.disMaxQuery()
    .queries([
        esb.matchQuery('subject', 'brown fox'),
        esb.matchQuery('message', 'brown fox')
    ])
    .tieBreaker(0.3);
Instance Members
▸ tieBreaker(factor)
src/queries/compound-queries/dis-max-query.js

The tie breaker value. The tie breaker capability allows results that include the same term in multiple fields to be judged better than results that include this term in only the best of those multiple fields, without confusing this with the better case of two different terms in the multiple fields. Default: 0.0.

tieBreaker(factor: number): DisMaxQuery
Parameters
factor (number)
Returns
DisMaxQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ queries(queries)
src/queries/compound-queries/dis-max-query.js

Add given query array or query to list of queries

queries(queries: (Array<Query> | Query)): DisMaxQuery
Parameters
queries ((Array<Query> | Query)) Array of valid Query objects or a Query object
Returns
DisMaxQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.

FunctionScoreQuery

src/queries/compound-queries/function-score-query.js

The function_score allows you to modify the score of documents that are retrieved by a query. This can be useful if, for example, a score function is computationally expensive and it is sufficient to compute the score on a filtered set of documents.

Elasticsearch reference

new FunctionScoreQuery()

Extends Query

Example
// `function_score` with only one function
const qry = esb.functionScoreQuery()
    .query(esb.matchAllQuery())
    .function(esb.randomScoreFunction())
    .boostMode('multiply')
    .boost('5');
// Several functions combined
const qry = esb.functionScoreQuery()
    .query(esb.matchAllQuery())
    .functions([
        esb.randomScoreFunction()
            .filter(esb.matchQuery('test', 'bar'))
            .weight(23),
        esb.weightScoreFunction()
            .filter(esb.matchQuery('test', 'cat'))
            .weight(42)
    ])
    .maxBoost(42)
    .scoreMode('max')
    .boostMode('multiply')
    .minScore(42)
    .boost('5');
// Combine decay functions
const qry = esb.functionScoreQuery()
    .functions([
        esb.decayScoreFunction('gauss', 'price').origin('0').scale('20'),
        esb.decayScoreFunction('gauss', 'location')
            .origin('11, 12')
            .scale('2km')
    ])
    .query(esb.matchQuery('properties', 'balcony'))
    .scoreMode('multiply');
Instance Members
▸ query(query)
src/queries/compound-queries/function-score-query.js

Sets the source query.

query(query: Query): FunctionScoreQuery
Parameters
query (Query) A valid Query object
Returns
FunctionScoreQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ scoreMode(mode)
src/queries/compound-queries/function-score-query.js

Controls the way the scores are combined.

scoreMode(mode: string): FunctionScoreQuery
Parameters
mode (string) Can be one of multiply , sum , first , min , max , avg . Defaults to multiply .
Returns
FunctionScoreQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ boostMode(mode)
src/queries/compound-queries/function-score-query.js

Controls the way the query and function scores are combined.

boostMode(mode: string): FunctionScoreQuery
Parameters
mode (string) Can be one of multiply , replace , sum , avg , max , min . Defaults to multiply .
Returns
FunctionScoreQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ maxBoost(limit)
src/queries/compound-queries/function-score-query.js

Restricts new score to not exceed given limit. The default for max_boost is FLT_MAX.

maxBoost(limit: number): FunctionScoreQuery
Parameters
limit (number)
Returns
FunctionScoreQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ minScore(limit)
src/queries/compound-queries/function-score-query.js

Sets the minimum score limit for documents to be included in search result.

minScore(limit: number): FunctionScoreQuery
Parameters
limit (number) Minimum score threshold
Returns
FunctionScoreQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ function(func)
src/queries/compound-queries/function-score-query.js

Add a single score function to the list of existing functions.

function(func: ScoreFunction): FunctionScoreQuery
Parameters
func (ScoreFunction) A valid ScoreFunction object.
Returns
FunctionScoreQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ functions(funcs)
src/queries/compound-queries/function-score-query.js

Adds array of score functions to the list of existing functions.

functions(funcs: Array<ScoreFunction>): FunctionScoreQuery
Parameters
funcs (Array<ScoreFunction>) An array of valid ScoreFunction objects
Returns
FunctionScoreQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.

BoostingQuery

src/queries/compound-queries/boosting-query.js

The boosting query can be used to effectively demote results that match a given query. Unlike the "NOT" clause in bool query, this still selects documents that contain undesirable terms, but reduces their overall score.

Elasticsearch reference

new BoostingQuery(positiveQry: Query?, negativeQry: Query?, negativeBoost: number?)

Extends Query

Parameters
positiveQry (Query?) A valid Query object.
negativeQry (Query?) A valid Query object.
negativeBoost (number?) A positive double value where 0 < n < 1 .
Example
const qry = esb.boostingQuery(
    esb.termQuery('field1', 'value1'), // positiveQry
    esb.termQuery('field2', 'value2'), // negativeQry
    0.2 // negativeBoost
);
Instance Members
▸ positive(query)
src/queries/compound-queries/boosting-query.js

Sets the "master" query that determines which results are returned.

positive(query: Query): BoostingQuery
Parameters
query (Query) A valid Query object.
Returns
BoostingQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ negative(query)
src/queries/compound-queries/boosting-query.js

Sets the query used to match documents in the positive query that will be negatively boosted.

negative(query: Query): BoostingQuery
Parameters
query (Query) A valid Query object.
Returns
BoostingQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ negativeBoost(factor)
src/queries/compound-queries/boosting-query.js

Sets the negative boost value.

negativeBoost(factor: number): BoostingQuery
Parameters
factor (number) A positive double value where 0 < n < 1 .
Returns
BoostingQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.

Joining Queries

Joining Queries

JoiningQueryBase

src/queries/joining-queries/joining-query-base.js

The JoiningQueryBase class provides support for common options used across various joining query implementations.

NOTE: Instantiating this directly should not be required. However, if you wish to add a custom implementation for whatever reason, this class could be extended.

new JoiningQueryBase(queryType: string, refUrl: string, qry: Query?)

Extends Query

Parameters
queryType (string)
refUrl (string)
qry (Query?) A valid Query object
Instance Members
▸ query(qry)
src/queries/joining-queries/joining-query-base.js

Sets the nested query to be executed.

query(qry: Query): JoiningQueryBase
Parameters
qry (Query) A valid Query object
Returns
JoiningQueryBase: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ scoreMode(mode)
src/queries/joining-queries/joining-query-base.js

Sets the scoring method.

Valid values are:

  • none - no scoring
  • max - the highest score of all matched child documents is used
  • min - the lowest score of all matched child documents is used
  • sum - the sum the all the matched child documents is used
  • avg - the default, the average of all matched child documents is used
scoreMode(mode: string): JoiningQueryBase
Parameters
mode (string) Can be one of none , sum , min , max , avg . Defaults to avg for NestedQuery , none for HasChildQuery .
Returns
JoiningQueryBase: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Example
const qry = esb.hasChildQuery(
    esb.termQuery('tag', 'something'),
    'blog_tag'
).scoreMode('min');
▸ ignoreUnmapped(enable)
src/queries/joining-queries/joining-query-base.js

When set to true will ignore an unmapped path and will not match any documents for this query. When set to false (the default value) the query will throw an exception if the path is not mapped.

ignoreUnmapped(enable: boolean): JoiningQueryBase
Parameters
enable (boolean) true or false , false by default.
Returns
JoiningQueryBase: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ innerHits(innerHits)
src/queries/joining-queries/joining-query-base.js

Sets the inner hits options

innerHits(innerHits: InnerHits): JoiningQueryBase
Parameters
innerHits (InnerHits) A valid InnerHits object
Returns
JoiningQueryBase: returns this so that calls can be chained.

NestedQuery

src/queries/joining-queries/nested-query.js

Nested query allows to query nested objects. The query is executed against the nested objects / docs as if they were indexed as separate docs (they are, internally) and resulting in the root parent doc (or parent nested mapping).

Elasticsearch reference

new NestedQuery(qry: Query?, path: string?)

Extends JoiningQueryBase

Parameters
qry (Query?) A valid Query object
path (string?) The nested object path.
Example
const qry = esb.nestedQuery()
    .path('obj1')
    .scoreMode('avg')
    .query(
        esb.boolQuery().must([
            esb.matchQuery('obj1.name', 'blue'),
            esb.rangeQuery('obj1.count').gt(5)
        ])
    );
Instance Members
▸ path(path)
src/queries/joining-queries/nested-query.js

Sets the root context for the nested query.

path(path: string): NestedQuery
Parameters
path (string)
Returns
NestedQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.

HasChildQuery

src/queries/joining-queries/has-child-query.js

The has_child filter accepts a query and the child type to run against, and results in parent documents that have child docs matching the query.

Elasticsearch reference

new HasChildQuery(qry: Query?, type: string?)

Extends JoiningQueryBase

Parameters
qry (Query?) A valid Query object
type (string?) The child type
Example
// Scoring support
const qry = esb.hasChildQuery(
    esb.termQuery('tag', 'something'),
    'blog_tag'
).scoreMode('min');
// Sort by child documents' `click_count` field
const qry = esb.hasChildQuery()
    .query(
        esb.functionScoreQuery().function(
            esb.scriptScoreFunction("_score * doc['click_count'].value")
        )
    )
    .type('blog_tag')
    .scoreMode('max');
Instance Members
▸ type(type)
src/queries/joining-queries/has-child-query.js

Sets the child document type to search against. Alias for method childType.

type(type: string): HasChildQuery
Parameters
type (string) A valid doc type name
Returns
HasChildQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ childType(type)
src/queries/joining-queries/has-child-query.js

Sets the child document type to search against

childType(type: string): HasChildQuery
Parameters
type (string) A valid doc type name
Returns
HasChildQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ minChildren(limit)
src/queries/joining-queries/has-child-query.js

Specify the minimum number of children are required to match for the parent doc to be considered a match

minChildren(limit: number): HasChildQuery
Parameters
limit (number) A positive integer value.
Returns
HasChildQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Example
const qry = esb.hasChildQuery(esb.termQuery('tag', 'something'), 'blog_tag')
    .minChildren(2)
    .maxChildren(10)
    .scoreMode('min');
▸ maxChildren(limit)
src/queries/joining-queries/has-child-query.js

Specify the maximum number of children are required to match for the parent doc to be considered a match

maxChildren(limit: number): HasChildQuery
Parameters
limit (number) A positive integer value.
Returns
HasChildQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Example
const qry = esb.hasChildQuery(esb.termQuery('tag', 'something'), 'blog_tag')
    .minChildren(2)
    .maxChildren(10)
    .scoreMode('min');

HasParentQuery

src/queries/joining-queries/has-parent-query.js

The has_parent query accepts a query and a parent type. The query is executed in the parent document space, which is specified by the parent type. This query returns child documents which associated parents have matched.

Elasticsearch reference

new HasParentQuery(qry: Query?, type: string?)

Extends JoiningQueryBase

Parameters
qry (Query?) A valid Query object
type (string?) The parent type
Example
const qry = esb.hasParentQuery(esb.termQuery('tag', 'something'), 'blog');
// Sorting tags by parent documents' `view_count` field
const qry = esb.hasParentQuery()
    .parentType('blog')
    .score(true)
    .query(
        esb.functionScoreQuery().function(
            esb.scriptScoreFunction("_score * doc['view_count'].value")
        )
    );
Instance Members
▸ scoreMode()
src/queries/joining-queries/has-parent-query.js
scoreMode()
Throws
  • Error: score_mode is deprecated. Use score instead.
▸ type(type)
src/queries/joining-queries/has-parent-query.js

Sets the child document type to search against Alias for method parentType

type(type: string): HasParentQuery
Parameters
type (string) A valid doc type name
Returns
HasParentQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ parentType(type)
src/queries/joining-queries/has-parent-query.js

Sets the child document type to search against

parentType(type: string): HasParentQuery
Parameters
type (string) A valid doc type name
Returns
HasParentQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ score(enable)
src/queries/joining-queries/has-parent-query.js

By default, scoring is false which ignores the score from the parent document. The score is in this case equal to the boost on the has_parent query (Defaults to 1). If the score is set to true, then the score of the matching parent document is aggregated into the child documents belonging to the matching parent document.

score(enable: boolean): HasParentQuery
Parameters
enable (boolean) true to enable scoring, false to disable. false by default.
Returns
HasParentQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Example
const qry = esb.hasParentQuery(
    esb.termQuery('tag', 'something'),
    'blog'
).score(true);

ParentIdQuery

src/queries/joining-queries/parent-id-query.js

The parent_id query can be used to find child documents which belong to a particular parent.

Elasticsearch reference

new ParentIdQuery(type: string?, id: (string | number)?)

Extends Query

Parameters
type (string?) The child type. This must be a type with _parent field.
id ((string | number)?) The required parent id select documents must refer to.
Example
const qry = esb.parentIdQuery('blog_tag', 1);
Instance Members
▸ type(type)
src/queries/joining-queries/parent-id-query.js

Sets the child type.

type(type: string): ParentIdQuery
Parameters
type (string) The child type. This must be a type with _parent field.
Returns
ParentIdQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ id(id)
src/queries/joining-queries/parent-id-query.js

Sets the id.

id(id: (string | number)): ParentIdQuery
Parameters
id ((string | number)) The required parent id select documents must refer to.
Returns
ParentIdQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ ignoreUnmapped(enable)
src/queries/joining-queries/parent-id-query.js

When set to true will ignore an unmapped path and will not match any documents for this query. When set to false (the default value) the query will throw an exception if the path is not mapped.

ignoreUnmapped(enable: boolean): ParentIdQuery
Parameters
enable (boolean) true or false , false by default.
Returns
ParentIdQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.

Geo Queries

Geo Queries

GeoQueryBase

src/queries/geo-queries/geo-query-base.js

The GeoQueryBase provides support for common options used across various geo query implementations.

NOTE: Instantiating this directly should not be required. However, if you wish to add a custom implementation for whatever reason, this class could be extended.

new GeoQueryBase(queryType: string, field: string?)

Extends Query

Parameters
queryType (string)
field (string?)
Instance Members
▸ field(field)
src/queries/geo-queries/geo-query-base.js

Sets the field to run the geo query on.

field(field: string): GeoQueryBase
Parameters
field (string)
Returns
GeoQueryBase: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ validationMethod(method)
src/queries/geo-queries/geo-query-base.js

Sets the validation_method parameter. Can be set to IGNORE_MALFORMED to accept geo points with invalid latitude or longitude, COERCE to try and infer correct latitude or longitude, or STRICT (default is STRICT).

Note: The ignore_malformed and coerce parameters have been removed from geo_bounding_box, geo_polygon, and geo_distance queries in elasticsearch 6.0.

validationMethod(method: string): GeoQueryBase
Parameters
method (string) One of IGNORE_MALFORMED , COERCE or STRICT (default)
Returns
GeoQueryBase: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Throws
  • Error: If method parameter is not one of IGNORE_MALFORMED , COERCE or STRICT
▸ toJSON()
src/queries/geo-queries/geo-query-base.js

Override default toJSON to return DSL representation of the geo query class instance.

toJSON(): Object
Returns
Object: returns an Object which maps to the elasticsearch query DSL

GeoShapeQuery

src/queries/geo-queries/geo-shape-query.js

Filter documents indexed using the geo_shape type. Requires the geo_shape Mapping.

The geo_shape query uses the same grid square representation as the geo_shape mapping to find documents that have a shape that intersects with the query shape. It will also use the same PrefixTree configuration as defined for the field mapping.

The query supports two ways of defining the query shape, either by providing a whole shape definition, or by referencing the name of a shape pre-indexed in another index.

Elasticsearch reference

new GeoShapeQuery(field: string?)

Extends GeoQueryBase

Parameters
field (string?)
Example
const geoQry = esb.geoShapeQuery('location')
    .shape(esb.geoShape()
        .type('envelope')
        .coordinates([[13.0, 53.0], [14.0, 52.0]]))
    .relation('within');
// Pre-indexed shape
const geoQry = esb.geoShapeQuery()
    .field('location')
    .indexedShape(esb.indexedShape()
        .id('DEU')
        .type('countries')
        .index('shapes')
        .path('location'))
Instance Members
▸ validationMethod()
src/queries/geo-queries/geo-shape-query.js
validationMethod()
Throws
  • Error: This method cannot be called on GeoShapeQuery
▸ shape(shape)
src/queries/geo-queries/geo-shape-query.js

Sets the shape definition for the geo query.

shape(shape: GeoShape): GeoShapeQuery
Parameters
shape (GeoShape)
Returns
GeoShapeQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Throws
  • TypeError: If given shape is not an instance of GeoShape
▸ indexedShape(shape)
src/queries/geo-queries/geo-shape-query.js

Sets the reference name of a shape pre-indexed in another index.

indexedShape(shape: IndexedShape): GeoShapeQuery
Parameters
shape (IndexedShape)
Returns
GeoShapeQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Throws
  • TypeError: If given shape is not an instance of IndexedShape
▸ relation(relation)
src/queries/geo-queries/geo-shape-query.js

Sets the relationship between Query and indexed data that will be used to determine if a Document should be matched or not.

relation(relation: string): GeoShapeQuery
Parameters
relation (string) Can be one of WITHIN , CONTAINS , DISJOINT or INTERSECTS (default)
Returns
GeoShapeQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ ignoreUnmapped(enable)
src/queries/geo-queries/geo-shape-query.js

When set to true will ignore an unmapped path and will not match any documents for this query. When set to false (the default value) the query will throw an exception if the path is not mapped.

ignoreUnmapped(enable: boolean): GeoShapeQuery
Parameters
enable (boolean) true or false , false by default.
Returns
GeoShapeQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.

GeoBoundingBoxQuery

src/queries/geo-queries/geo-bounding-box-query.js

A query allowing to filter hits based on a point location using a bounding box.

Elasticsearch reference

new GeoBoundingBoxQuery(field: string?)

Extends GeoQueryBase

Parameters
field (string?)
Example
// Format of point in Geohash
const qry = esb.geoBoundingBoxQuery('pin.location')
    .topLeft(esb.geoPoint().string('dr5r9ydj2y73'))
    .bottomRight(esb.geoPoint().string('drj7teegpus6'));
// Format of point with lat lon as properties
const qry = esb.geoBoundingBoxQuery()
    .field('pin.location')
    .topLeft(esb.geoPoint()
        .lat(40.73)
        .lon(-74.1))
    .bottomRight(esb.geoPoint()
        .lat(40.10)
        .lon(-71.12));
// Set bounding box values separately
const qry = esb.geoBoundingBoxQuery('pin.location')
    .top(40.73)
    .left(-74.1)
    .bottom(40.01)
    .right(-71.12);
Instance Members
▸ topLeft(point)
src/queries/geo-queries/geo-bounding-box-query.js

Sets the top left coordinate for the Geo bounding box filter for querying documents

topLeft(point: GeoPoint): GeoBoundingBoxQuery
Parameters
point (GeoPoint) A valid GeoPoint
Returns
GeoBoundingBoxQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ bottomRight(point)

bottomRight(point: GeoPoint): GeoBoundingBoxQuery
Parameters
point (GeoPoint) A valid GeoPoint
Returns
GeoBoundingBoxQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ topRight(point)
src/queries/geo-queries/geo-bounding-box-query.js

Sets the top right coordinate for the Geo bounding box filter for querying documents

topRight(point: GeoPoint): GeoBoundingBoxQuery
Parameters
point (GeoPoint) A valid GeoPoint
Returns
GeoBoundingBoxQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ bottomLeft(point)
src/queries/geo-queries/geo-bounding-box-query.js

Sets the bottom left coordinate for the Geo bounding box filter for querying documents

bottomLeft(point: GeoPoint): GeoBoundingBoxQuery
Parameters
point (GeoPoint) A valid GeoPoint
Returns
GeoBoundingBoxQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.

▸ right(val)

Sets value for right of the bounding box.

right(val: number): GeoBoundingBoxQuery
Parameters
val (number)
Returns
GeoBoundingBoxQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ type(type)
src/queries/geo-queries/geo-bounding-box-query.js

Sets the type of execution for the bounding box query. The type of the bounding box execution by default is set to memory, which means in memory checks if the doc falls within the bounding box range. In some cases, an indexed option will perform faster (but note that the geo_point type must have lat and lon indexed in this case)

type(type: string): GeoBoundingBoxQuery
Parameters
type (string) Can either memory or indexed
Returns
GeoBoundingBoxQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Example
const geoQry = esb.geoBoundingBoxQuery()
    .field('pin.location')
    .topLeft(esb.geoPoint()
        .lat(40.73)
        .lon(-74.1))
    .bottomRight(esb.geoPoint()
        .lat(40.10)
        .lon(-71.12))
    .type('indexed');

GeoDistanceQuery

src/queries/geo-queries/geo-distance-query.js

Filters documents that include only hits that exists within a specific distance from a geo point.

Elasticsearch reference

new GeoDistanceQuery(field: string?, point: GeoPoint?)

Extends GeoQueryBase

Parameters
field (string?)
point (GeoPoint?) Geo point used to measure and filter documents based on distance from it.
Example
const qry = esb.geoDistanceQuery('pin.location', esb.geoPoint().lat(40).lon(-70))
    .distance('12km');

const qry = esb.geoDistanceQuery()
    .field('pin.location')
    .distance('200km')
    .geoPoint(esb.geoPoint().lat(40).lon(-70));
Instance Members
▸ distance(distance)
src/queries/geo-queries/geo-distance-query.js

Sets the radius of the circle centred on the specified location. Points which fall into this circle are considered to be matches. The distance can be specified in various units.

distance(distance: (string | number)): GeoDistanceQuery
Parameters
distance ((string | number)) Radius of circle centred on specified location.
Returns
GeoDistanceQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ distanceType(type)
src/queries/geo-queries/geo-distance-query.js

Sets the distance calculation mode, arc or plane. The arc calculation is the more accurate. The plane is the faster but least accurate.

distanceType(type: string): GeoDistanceQuery
Parameters
type (string)
Returns
GeoDistanceQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained
Throws
  • Error: If type is neither plane nor arc .
▸ geoPoint(point)
src/queries/geo-queries/geo-distance-query.js

Sets the point to filter documents based on the distance from it.

geoPoint(point: GeoPoint): GeoDistanceQuery
Parameters
point (GeoPoint) Geo point used to measure and filter documents based on distance from it.
Returns
GeoDistanceQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained
Throws
  • TypeError: If parameter point is not an instance of GeoPoint

GeoPolygonQuery

src/queries/geo-queries/geo-polygon-query.js

A query allowing to include hits that only fall within a polygon of points.

Elasticsearch reference

new GeoPolygonQuery(field: string?)

Extends GeoQueryBase

Parameters
field (string?)
Example
const geoQry = esb.geoPolygonQuery('person.location')
    .points([
        {"lat" : 40, "lon" : -70},
        {"lat" : 30, "lon" : -80},
        {"lat" : 20, "lon" : -90}
    ]);
Instance Members
▸ points(points)
src/queries/geo-queries/geo-polygon-query.js

Sets the points which form the polygon. Points can be instances of GeoPoint, Object with lat, lon keys, GeoJSON array representation or string(geohash/lat, lon)

points(points: Array<any>): GeoPolygonQuery
Parameters
points (Array<any>)
Returns
GeoPolygonQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained
Throws
  • TypeError: If points parameter is not an instance of Array .
Example
// Format in `[lon, lat]`
const qry = esb.geoPolygonQuery('person.location').points([
    [-70, 40],
    [-80, 30],
    [-90, 20]
]);
// Format in lat,lon
const qry = esb.geoPolygonQuery('person.location').points([
    '40, -70',
    '30, -80',
    '20, -90'
]);
// Geohash
const qry = esb.geoPolygonQuery('person.location').points([
    'drn5x1g8cu2y',
    '30, -80',
    '20, -90'
]);

Specialized Queries

Specialized Queries

MoreLikeThisQuery

src/queries/specialized-queries/more-like-this-query.js

The More Like This Query (MLT Query) finds documents that are "like" a given set of documents. In order to do so, MLT selects a set of representative terms of these input documents, forms a query using these terms, executes the query and returns the results. The user controls the input documents, how the terms should be selected and how the query is formed.

Elasticsearch reference

new MoreLikeThisQuery()

Extends Query

Example
// Ask for documents that are similar to a provided piece of text
const qry = esb.moreLikeThisQuery()
    .fields(['title', 'description'])
    .like('Once upon a time')
    .minTermFreq(1)
    .maxQueryTerms(12);
// Mixing texts with documents already existing in the index
const qry = esb.moreLikeThisQuery()
    .fields(['title', 'description'])
    .like({ _index: 'imdb', _type: 'movies', _id: '1' })
    .like({ _index: 'imdb', _type: 'movies', _id: '2' })
    .like('and potentially some more text here as well')
    .minTermFreq(1)
    .maxQueryTerms(12);
// Provide documents not present in the index
const qry = esb.moreLikeThisQuery()
    .fields(['name.first', 'name.last'])
    .like([
        {
            _index: 'marvel',
            _type: 'quotes',
            doc: {
                name: { first: 'Ben', last: 'Grimm' },
                tweet: "You got no idea what I'd... what I'd give to be invisible."
            }
        },
        { _index: 'marvel', _type: 'quotes', _id: '2' }
    ])
    .minTermFreq(1)
    .maxQueryTerms(12);
Instance Members
▸ fields(fields)
src/queries/specialized-queries/more-like-this-query.js

Sets the list of fields to fetch and analyze the text from. Defaults to the _all field for free text and to all possible fields for document inputs.

fields(fields: Array<string>): MoreLikeThisQuery
Parameters
fields (Array<string>) Array of fields to search against
Returns
MoreLikeThisQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ like(like)
src/queries/specialized-queries/more-like-this-query.js

Sets the search clause for the query. It is the only required parameter of the MLT query and follows a versatile syntax, in which the user can specify free form text and/or a single or multiple documents (see examples above). The syntax to specify documents is similar to the one used by the Multi GET API. When specifying documents, the text is fetched from fields unless overridden in each document request. The text is analyzed by the analyzer at the field, but could also be overridden. The syntax to override the analyzer at the field follows a similar syntax to the per_field_analyzer parameter of the Term Vectors API. Additionally, to provide documents not necessarily present in the index, artificial documents are also supported.

If string or object is passed, it is appended to the list. If an array is passed, it replaces the existing list.

like(like: (string | Object | Array)): MoreLikeThisQuery
Parameters
like ((string | Object | Array)) Can be passed as a string, Object representing indexed document, or array of string/objects.
Returns
MoreLikeThisQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ unlike(unlike)
src/queries/specialized-queries/more-like-this-query.js

The unlike parameter is used in conjunction with like in order not to select terms found in a chosen set of documents. In other words, we could ask for documents like: "Apple", but unlike: "cake crumble tree". The syntax is the same as like.

unlike(unlike: (string | Object | Array)): MoreLikeThisQuery
Parameters
unlike ((string | Object | Array)) Can be passed as a string, Object representing indexed document, or array of string/objects.
Returns
MoreLikeThisQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ likeText(txt)
src/queries/specialized-queries/more-like-this-query.js

Sets the text to find documents like it.

Note: This parameter has been removed in elasticsearch 6.0. Use like instead.

likeText(txt: string): MoreLikeThisQuery
Parameters
txt (string) The text to find documents like it.
Returns
MoreLikeThisQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ ids(ids)
src/queries/specialized-queries/more-like-this-query.js

Sets the list of ids for the documents with syntax similar to the Multi GET API.

Note: This parameter has been removed in elasticsearch 6.0. Use like instead.

ids(ids: Array<string>): MoreLikeThisQuery
Parameters
ids (Array<string>)
Returns
MoreLikeThisQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ docs(docs)
src/queries/specialized-queries/more-like-this-query.js

Sets the list of docs for the documents with syntax similar to the Multi GET API.

Note: This parameter has been removed in elasticsearch 6.0. Use like instead.

docs(docs: Array<Object>): MoreLikeThisQuery
Parameters
docs (Array<Object>)
Returns
MoreLikeThisQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ maxQueryTerms(termsLimit)
src/queries/specialized-queries/more-like-this-query.js

Sets the maximum number of query terms that will be selected. Increasing this value gives greater accuracy at the expense of query execution speed. Defaults to 25.

maxQueryTerms(termsLimit: number): MoreLikeThisQuery
Parameters
termsLimit (number) The maximum number of query terms that will be selected.
Returns
MoreLikeThisQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ minTermFreq(termFreqLimit)
src/queries/specialized-queries/more-like-this-query.js

Sets the minimum term frequency below which the terms will be ignored from the input document Defaults to 2.

minTermFreq(termFreqLimit: number): MoreLikeThisQuery
Parameters
termFreqLimit (number)
Returns
MoreLikeThisQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ minDocFreq(docFreqLimit)
src/queries/specialized-queries/more-like-this-query.js

Sets the minimum document frequency below which the terms will be ignored from the input document. Defaults to 5.

minDocFreq(docFreqLimit: number): MoreLikeThisQuery
Parameters
docFreqLimit (number) The minimum document frequency
Returns
MoreLikeThisQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ maxDocFreq(docFreqLimit)
src/queries/specialized-queries/more-like-this-query.js

Sets the maximum document frequency above which the terms will be ignored from the input document. Defaults to unbounded (0).

maxDocFreq(docFreqLimit: number): MoreLikeThisQuery
Parameters
docFreqLimit (number) The minimum document frequency
Returns
MoreLikeThisQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ minWordLength(wordLenLimit)
src/queries/specialized-queries/more-like-this-query.js

Sets the minimum word length below which the terms will be ignored. Defaults to 0.

minWordLength(wordLenLimit: number): MoreLikeThisQuery
Parameters
wordLenLimit (number)
Returns
MoreLikeThisQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ maxWordLength(wordLenLimit)
src/queries/specialized-queries/more-like-this-query.js

Sets the maximum word length above which the terms will be ignored. Defaults to unbounded (0).

maxWordLength(wordLenLimit: number): MoreLikeThisQuery
Parameters
wordLenLimit (number)
Returns
MoreLikeThisQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ stopWords(words)
src/queries/specialized-queries/more-like-this-query.js

Sets the array of stop words. Any word in this set is considered "uninteresting" and ignored.

stopWords(words: Array<string>): MoreLikeThisQuery
Parameters
words (Array<string>) Array of stop words.
Returns
MoreLikeThisQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ analyzer(analyzer)
src/queries/specialized-queries/more-like-this-query.js

Set the analyzer to control which analyzer will perform the analysis process on the text. Defaults to the analyzer associated with the first field in fields.

analyzer(analyzer: string): MoreLikeThisQuery
Parameters
analyzer (string) A valid text analyzer.
Returns
MoreLikeThisQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ minimumShouldMatch(minimumShouldMatch)
src/queries/specialized-queries/more-like-this-query.js

Sets the value controlling how many should clauses in the boolean query should match. It can be an absolute value (2), a percentage (30%) or a combination of both. (Defaults to "30%").

minimumShouldMatch(minimumShouldMatch: (string | number)): MoreLikeThisQuery
Parameters
minimumShouldMatch ((string | number)) An absolute value ( 2 ), a percentage ( 30% ) or a combination of both.
Returns
MoreLikeThisQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ boostTerms(boost)
src/queries/specialized-queries/more-like-this-query.js

Sets the boost factor to use when boosting terms. Defaults to deactivated (0).

boostTerms(boost: number): MoreLikeThisQuery
Parameters
boost (number) A positive value to boost terms.
Returns
MoreLikeThisQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ include(enable)
src/queries/specialized-queries/more-like-this-query.js

Specifies whether the input documents should also be included in the search results returned. Defaults to false.

include(enable: boolean): MoreLikeThisQuery
Parameters
enable (boolean)
Returns
MoreLikeThisQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.

ScriptQuery

src/queries/specialized-queries/script-query.js

A query allowing to define scripts as queries. They are typically used in a filter context.

Elasticsearch reference

new ScriptQuery(script: Script?)

Extends Query

Parameters
script (Script?)
Example
const scriptQry = esb.scriptQuery(esb.script()
 .lang('painless')
 .inline("doc['num1'].value > 1"))

// Use in filter context
const qry = esb.boolQuery().must(scriptQry);
Instance Members
▸ script(script)
src/queries/specialized-queries/script-query.js

Sets the script for query.

script(script: Script): ScriptQuery
Parameters
script (Script)
Returns
ScriptQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.

PercolateQuery

src/queries/specialized-queries/percolate-query.js

The percolate query can be used to match queries stored in an index. The percolate query itself contains the document that will be used as query to match with the stored queries.

Elasticsearch reference

new PercolateQuery(field: string?, docType: string?)

Extends Query

Parameters
field (string?) The field of type percolator and that holds the indexed queries.
docType (string?) The type / mapping of the document being percolated.
Example
const percolateQry = esb.percolateQuery('query', 'doctype')
    .document({ message: 'A new bonsai tree in the office' });

const percolateQry = esb.percolateQuery()
    .field('query')
    .documentType('doctype')
    .index('my-index')
    .type('message')
    .id('1')
    .version(1);
Instance Members
▸ field(field)
src/queries/specialized-queries/percolate-query.js

Sets the field of type percolator and that holds the indexed queries.

field(field: string): PercolateQuery
Parameters
field (string) The field of type percolator and that holds the indexed queries.
Returns
PercolateQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ documentType(docType)
src/queries/specialized-queries/percolate-query.js

Sets the type / mapping of the document being percolated.

Note: This param has been deprecated in elasticsearch 6.0. From 6.0 and later, it is no longer required to specify the document_type parameter.

documentType(docType: string): PercolateQuery
Parameters
docType (string) The type / mapping of the document being percolated.
Returns
PercolateQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ document(doc)
src/queries/specialized-queries/percolate-query.js

Appends given source document to the list of source documents being percolated. Instead of specifying the source document being percolated, the source can also be retrieved from an already stored document.

document(doc: Object): PercolateQuery
Parameters
doc (Object) The source document being percolated.
Returns
PercolateQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Example
const qry = esb.percolateQuery('query', 'people')
.document({ name: 'Will Smith' });
▸ documents(docs)
src/queries/specialized-queries/percolate-query.js

Appends given source documents to the list of source documents being percolated. Instead of specifying the source documents being percolated, the source can also be retrieved from already stored documents.

documents(docs: Array<Object>): PercolateQuery
Parameters
docs (Array<Object>) The source documents being percolated.
Returns
PercolateQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Example
const qry = esb.percolateQuery('query', 'people')
.documents([{ name: 'Will Smith' }, { name: 'Willow Smith' }]);
▸ index(index)
src/queries/specialized-queries/percolate-query.js

Sets the index the document resides in. This is a required parameter if document is not specified.

index(index: string): PercolateQuery
Parameters
index (string) The index the document resides in.
Returns
PercolateQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ type(type)
src/queries/specialized-queries/percolate-query.js

Sets the type of the document to fetch. This is a required parameter if document is not specified.

type(type: string): PercolateQuery
Parameters
type (string) The type of the document to fetch.
Returns
PercolateQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ id(id)
src/queries/specialized-queries/percolate-query.js

Sets the id of the document to fetch. This is a required parameter if document is not specified.

id(id: string): PercolateQuery
Parameters
id (string) The id of the document to fetch.
Returns
PercolateQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ routing(routing)
src/queries/specialized-queries/percolate-query.js

Sets the routing to be used to fetch document to percolate. Optional.

routing(routing: string): PercolateQuery
Parameters
routing (string) The routing to be used to fetch document to percolate.
Returns
PercolateQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ preference(preference)
src/queries/specialized-queries/percolate-query.js

Sets the preference to be used to fetch document to percolate. Optional.

preference(preference: string): PercolateQuery
Parameters
preference (string) The preference to be used to fetch document to percolate.
Returns
PercolateQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ version(version)
src/queries/specialized-queries/percolate-query.js

Sets the expected version of the document to be fetched. Optional. If the version does not match, the search request will fail with a version conflict error.

version(version: string): PercolateQuery
Parameters
version (string) The expected version of the document to be fetched.
Returns
PercolateQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.

Span Queries

Span Queries

SpanQueryBase

src/queries/span-queries/span-query-base.js

Interface-like class used to group and identify various implementations of Span queries.

NOTE: Instantiating this directly should not be required. However, if you wish to add a custom implementation for whatever reason, this class could be extended.

new SpanQueryBase()

Extends Query

SpanTermQuery

src/queries/span-queries/span-term-query.js

Matches spans containing a term. The span term query maps to Lucene SpanTermQuery.

Elasticsearch reference

new SpanTermQuery(field: string?, value: (string | number)?)

Extends SpanQueryBase

Parameters
field (string?) The document field to query against
value ((string | number)?) The query string
Example
const qry = esb.spanTermQuery('user', 'kimchy');
const qry = esb.spanTermQuery()
    .field('user')
    .value('kimchy')
    .boost(2.0);
Instance Members
▸ field(field)
src/queries/span-queries/span-term-query.js

Sets the field to search on.

field(field: string): SpanTermQuery
Parameters
field (string)
Returns
SpanTermQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ value(queryVal)
src/queries/span-queries/span-term-query.js

Sets the query string.

value(queryVal: (string | number)): SpanTermQuery
Parameters
queryVal ((string | number))
Returns
SpanTermQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ toJSON()
src/queries/span-queries/span-term-query.js

Override default toJSON to return DSL representation of the Span term query class instance.

toJSON(): Object
Returns
Object: returns an Object which maps to the elasticsearch query DSL

SpanMultiTermQuery

src/queries/span-queries/span-multi-term-query.js

The span_multi query allows you to wrap a multi term query (one of wildcard, fuzzy, prefix, range or regexp query) as a span query, so it can be nested.

Elasticsearch reference

new SpanMultiTermQuery(multiTermQry: MultiTermQueryBase?)

Extends SpanQueryBase

Parameters
multiTermQry (MultiTermQueryBase?) One of wildcard, fuzzy, prefix, range or regexp query
Example
const spanQry = esb.spanMultiTermQuery()
    .match(esb.prefixQuery('user', 'ki').boost(1.08));
Instance Members
▸ match(multiTermQry)
src/queries/span-queries/span-multi-term-query.js

Sets the multi term query.

match(multiTermQry: MultiTermQueryBase): SpanMultiTermQuery
Parameters
multiTermQry (MultiTermQueryBase) One of wildcard, fuzzy, prefix, range or regexp query
Returns
SpanMultiTermQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.

SpanFirstQuery

src/queries/span-queries/span-first-query.js

Matches spans near the beginning of a field. The span first query maps to Lucene SpanFirstQuery.

Elasticsearch reference

new SpanFirstQuery(spanQry: SpanQueryBase?)

Extends SpanQueryBase

Parameters
spanQry (SpanQueryBase?) Any other span type query
Example
const spanQry = esb.spanFirstQuery()
    .match(esb.spanTermQuery('user', 'kimchy'))
    .end(3);
Instance Members
▸ match(spanQry)

Sets the match clause which can be any other span type query.

match(spanQry: SpanQueryBase): SpanFirstQuery
Parameters
spanQry (SpanQueryBase)
Returns
SpanFirstQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.

Sets the maximum end position permitted in a match.

Parameters
limit (number) The maximum end position permitted in a match.
Returns
SpanFirstQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.

SpanNearQuery

src/queries/span-queries/span-near-query.js

Matches spans which are near one another. One can specify slop, the maximum number of intervening unmatched positions, as well as whether matches are required to be in-order. The span near query maps to Lucene SpanNearQuery.

Elasticsearch reference

new SpanNearQuery()

Extends SpanQueryBase

Example
const spanQry = esb.spanNearQuery()
    .clauses([
        esb.spanTermQuery('field', 'value1'),
        esb.spanTermQuery('field', 'value2'),
        esb.spanTermQuery('field', 'value3')
    ])
    .slop(12)
    .inOrder(false);
Instance Members
▸ clauses(clauses)
src/queries/span-queries/span-near-query.js

Sets the clauses element which is a list of one or more other span type queries.

clauses(clauses: Array<SpanQueryBase>): SpanNearQuery
Parameters
clauses (Array<SpanQueryBase>)
Returns
SpanNearQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Throws
  • TypeError: If parameter clauses is not an instance of Array or if any member of the array is not an instance of SpanQueryBase .
▸ slop(slop)
src/queries/span-queries/span-near-query.js

Configures the slop(default is 0), the maximum number of intervening unmatched positions permitted.

slop(slop: number): SpanNearQuery
Parameters
slop (number) A positive integer value, defaults is 0.
Returns
SpanNearQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ inOrder(enable)
src/queries/span-queries/span-near-query.js
inOrder(enable: boolean): SpanNearQuery
Parameters
enable (boolean)
Returns
SpanNearQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.

SpanOrQuery

src/queries/span-queries/span-or-query.js

Matches the union of its span clauses. The span or query maps to Lucene SpanOrQuery.

Elasticsearch reference

new SpanOrQuery()

Extends SpanQueryBase

Example
const spanQry = esb.spanOrQuery()
    .clauses([
        esb.spanTermQuery('field', 'value1'),
        esb.spanTermQuery('field', 'value2'),
        esb.spanTermQuery('field', 'value3')
    ]);
Instance Members
▸ clauses(clauses)
src/queries/span-queries/span-or-query.js

Sets the clauses element which is a list of one or more other span type queries.

clauses(clauses: Array<SpanQueryBase>): SpanOrQuery
Parameters
clauses (Array<SpanQueryBase>)
Returns
SpanOrQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
Throws
  • TypeError: If parameter clauses is not an instance of Array or if any member of the array is not an instance of SpanQueryBase .

SpanNotQuery

src/queries/span-queries/span-not-query.js

Removes matches which overlap with another span query. The span not query maps to Lucene SpanNotQuery.

Elasticsearch reference

new SpanNotQuery()

Extends SpanQueryBase

Example
const spanQry = esb.spanNotQuery()
    .include(esb.spanTermQuery('field1', 'hoya'))
    .exclude(esb.spanNearQuery()
        .clauses([
            esb.spanTermQuery('field1', 'la'),
            esb.spanTermQuery('field1', 'hoya')
        ])
        .slop(0)
        .inOrder(true));
Instance Members
▸ include(spanQry)
src/queries/span-queries/span-not-query.js

Sets the include clause which is the span query whose matches are filtered

include(spanQry: SpanQueryBase): SpanNotQuery
Parameters
spanQry (SpanQueryBase)
Returns
SpanNotQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ exclude(spanQry)
src/queries/span-queries/span-not-query.js

Sets the exclude clause which is the span query whose matches must not overlap those returned.

exclude(spanQry: SpanQueryBase): SpanNotQuery
Parameters
spanQry (SpanQueryBase)
Returns
SpanNotQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ pre(pre)
src/queries/span-queries/span-not-query.js

If set the amount of tokens before the include span can't have overlap with the exclude span.

pre(pre: number): SpanNotQuery
Parameters
pre (number)
Returns
SpanNotQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ post(post)
src/queries/span-queries/span-not-query.js

If set the amount of tokens after the include span can't have overlap with the exclude span.

post(post: number): SpanNotQuery
Parameters
post (number)
Returns
SpanNotQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ dist(dist)
src/queries/span-queries/span-not-query.js

If set the amount of tokens from within the include span can't have overlap with the exclude span. Equivalent of setting both pre and post.

dist(dist: number): SpanNotQuery
Parameters
dist (number)
Returns
SpanNotQuery: returns this so that calls can be chained.

SpanLittleBigQueryBase

src/queries/span-queries/span-little-big-query-base.js

Base class for span queries with little, big clauses.

NOTE: Instantiating this directly should not be required. However, if you wish to add a custom implementation for whatever reason, this class could be extended.

new SpanLittleBigQueryBase()

Extends SpanQueryBase

Instance Members

Sets the little clause.
