SignificantTermsAggregation

src/aggregations/bucket-aggregations/significant-terms-aggregation.js

An aggregation that returns interesting or unusual occurrences of terms in a set.

Elasticsearch reference

new SignificantTermsAggregation(name: string, field: string?)

Extends SignificantAggregationBase

Parameters
name (string) The name which will be used to refer to this aggregation.
field (string?) The field to aggregate on
Example
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .query(esb.termsQuery('force', 'British Transport Police'))
    .agg(
        esb.significantTermsAggregation(
            'significantCrimeTypes',
            'crime_type'
        )
    );
// Use parent aggregation for segregated data analysis
const agg = esb.termsAggregation('forces', 'force').agg(
    esb.significantTermsAggregation('significantCrimeTypes', 'crime_type')
);

SignificantTextAggregation

src/aggregations/bucket-aggregations/significant-text-aggregation.js

An aggregation that returns interesting or unusual occurrences of free-text terms in a set. It is like the SignificantTermsAggregation but differs in that:

  • It is specifically designed for use on type text fields
  • It does not require field data or doc-values
  • It re-analyzes text content on-the-fly meaning it can also filter duplicate sections of noisy text that otherwise tend to skew statistics.

Elasticsearch reference

NOTE: This query was added in elasticsearch v6.0.

new SignificantTextAggregation(name: string, field: string?)

Extends SignificantAggregationBase

Parameters
name (string) The name which will be used to refer to this aggregation.
field (string?) The field to aggregate on
Example
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
  .query(esb.matchQuery('content', 'Bird flu'))
  .agg(
    esb.samplerAggregation('my_sample')
      .shardSize(100)
      .agg(esb.significantTextAggregation('keywords', 'content'))
  );
Instance Members
▸ filterDuplicateText(enable)
src/aggregations/bucket-aggregations/significant-text-aggregation.js

Control if duplicate paragraphs of text should try be filtered from the statistical text analysis. Can improve results but slows down analysis. Default is false.

filterDuplicateText(enable: boolean): SignificantTextAggregation
Parameters
enable (boolean)
Returns
SignificantTextAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
Example
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
  .query(esb.matchQuery('content', 'elasticsearch'))
  .agg(
    esb.samplerAggregation('sample')
      .shardSize(100)
      .agg(
        esb.significantTextAggregation('keywords', 'content')
          .filterDuplicateText(true)
      )
  );
▸ sourceFields(srcFields)
src/aggregations/bucket-aggregations/significant-text-aggregation.js

Selects the fields to load from _source JSON and analyze. If none are specified, the indexed "fieldName" value is assumed to also be the name of the JSON field holding the value

sourceFields(srcFields: Array<string>): SignificantTextAggregation
Parameters
srcFields (Array<string>) Array of fields
Returns
SignificantTextAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
Example
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
  .query(esb.matchQuery('custom_all', 'elasticsearch'))
  .agg(
    esb.significantTextAggregation('tags', 'custom_all')
      .sourceFields(['content', 'title'])
  );
▸ missing()
src/aggregations/bucket-aggregations/significant-text-aggregation.js
missing()
Throws
  • Error: This method cannot be called on SignificantTextAggregation
▸ executionHint()
src/aggregations/bucket-aggregations/significant-text-aggregation.js
executionHint()
Throws
  • Error: This method cannot be called on SignificantTextAggregation

TermsAggregation

src/aggregations/bucket-aggregations/terms-aggregation.js

A multi-bucket value source based aggregation where buckets are dynamically built - one per unique value.

Elasticsearch reference

new TermsAggregation(name: string, field: string?)

Extends TermsAggregationBase

Parameters
name (string) The name which will be used to refer to this aggregation.
field (string?) The field to aggregate on
Example
const agg = esb.termsAggregation('genres', 'genre');
Instance Members
▸ showTermDocCountError(enable)
src/aggregations/bucket-aggregations/terms-aggregation.js

When set to true, shows an error value for each term returned by the aggregation which represents the worst case error in the document count and can be useful when deciding on a value for the shard_size parameter.

showTermDocCountError(enable: boolean): TermsAggregation
Parameters
enable (boolean)
Returns
TermsAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ includePartition(partition, numPartitions)
src/aggregations/bucket-aggregations/terms-aggregation.js

Break the analysis up into multiple requests by grouping the field’s values into a number of partitions at query-time and processing only one partition in each request.

Note that this method is a special case as the name doesn't map to the elasticsearch parameter name. This is required because there is already a method for include applicable for Terms aggregations. However, this could change depending on community interest.

includePartition(partition: number, numPartitions: number): TermsAggregation
Parameters
partition (number)
numPartitions (number)
Returns
TermsAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
Example
const agg = esb.termsAggregation('expired_sessions', 'account_id')
    .includePartition(0, 20)
    .size(10000)
    .order('last_access', 'asc')
    .agg(esb.maxAggregation('last_access', 'access_date'));
▸ collectMode(mode)
src/aggregations/bucket-aggregations/terms-aggregation.js

Can be used for deferring calculation of child aggregations by using breadth_first mode. In depth_first mode all branches of the aggregation tree are expanded in one depth-first pass and only then any pruning occurs.

collectMode(mode: string): TermsAggregation
Parameters
mode (string) The possible values are breadth_first and depth_first .
Returns
TermsAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
Example
const agg = esb.termsAggregation('actors', 'actors')
    .size(10)
    .collectMode('breadth_first')
    .agg(esb.termsAggregation('costars', 'actors').size(5));
▸ order(key, direction)
src/aggregations/bucket-aggregations/terms-aggregation.js

Sets the ordering for buckets

order(key: string, direction: string): TermsAggregation
Parameters
key (string)
direction (string = 'desc') asc or desc
Returns
TermsAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
Example
// Ordering the buckets by their doc `_count` in an ascending manner
const agg = esb.termsAggregation('genres', 'genre').order('_count', 'asc');
// Ordering the buckets alphabetically by their terms in an ascending manner
const agg = esb.termsAggregation('genres', 'genre').order('_term', 'asc');
// Ordering the buckets by single value metrics sub-aggregation
// (identified by the aggregation name)
const agg = esb.termsAggregation('genres', 'genre')
    .order('max_play_count', 'asc')
    .agg(esb.maxAggregation('max_play_count', 'play_count'));
// Ordering the buckets by multi value metrics sub-aggregation
// (identified by the aggregation name):
const agg = esb.termsAggregation('genres', 'genre')
    .order('playback_stats.max', 'desc')
    .agg(esb.statsAggregation('playback_stats', 'play_count'));
// Multiple order criteria
const agg = esb.termsAggregation('countries')
    .field('artist.country')
    .order('rock>playback_stats.avg', 'desc')
    .order('_count', 'desc')
    .agg(
        esb.filterAggregation('rock')
            .filter(esb.termQuery('genre', 'rock'))
            .agg(esb.statsAggregation('playback_stats', 'play_count'))
    );

Pipeline Aggregations

Pipeline Aggregations

PipelineAggregationBase

src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/pipeline-aggregation-base.js

The PipelineAggregationBase provides support for common options used across various pipeline Aggregation implementations.

Pipeline aggregations cannot have sub-aggregations but depending on the type it can reference another pipeline in the buckets_path allowing pipeline aggregations to be chained. For example, you can chain together two derivatives to calculate the second derivative (i.e. a derivative of a derivative).

NOTE: Instantiating this directly should not be required. However, if you wish to add a custom implementation for whatever reason, this class could be extended.

new PipelineAggregationBase(name: string, aggType: string, refUrl: string, bucketsPath: (string | Object)?)

Extends Aggregation

Parameters
name (string) a valid aggregation name
aggType (string) type of aggregation
refUrl (string) Elasticsearch reference URL
bucketsPath ((string | Object)?) The relative path of metric to aggregate over
Instance Members
▸ bucketsPath(path)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/pipeline-aggregation-base.js

Sets the relative path, buckets_path, which refers to the metric to aggregate over. Required.

Elasticsearch reference

bucketsPath(path: (string | Object)): PipelineAggregationBase
Parameters
path ((string | Object))
Returns
PipelineAggregationBase: returns this so that calls can be chained
Example
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('histo', 'date')
            .interval('day')
            .agg(esb.termsAggregation('categories', 'category'))
            .agg(
                esb.bucketSelectorAggregation('min_bucket_selector')
                    .bucketsPath({ count: 'categories._bucket_count' })
                    .script(esb.script('inline', 'params.count != 0'))
            )
    )
    .size(0);
▸ gapPolicy(policy)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/pipeline-aggregation-base.js

Set policy for missing data. Optional.

Elasticsearch reference

gapPolicy(policy: string): PipelineAggregationBase
Parameters
policy (string) Can be skip or insert_zeros
Returns
PipelineAggregationBase: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ format(fmt)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/pipeline-aggregation-base.js

Sets the format expression if applicable. Optional.

format(fmt: string): PipelineAggregationBase
Parameters
fmt (string) Format mask to apply on aggregation response. Example: ####.00
Returns
PipelineAggregationBase: returns this so that calls can be chained

AvgBucketAggregation

src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/avg-bucket-aggregation.js

A sibling pipeline aggregation which calculates the (mean) average value of a specified metric in a sibling aggregation. The specified metric must be numeric and the sibling aggregation must be a multi-bucket aggregation.

Elasticsearch reference

new AvgBucketAggregation(name: string, bucketsPath: string?)

Extends PipelineAggregationBase

Parameters
name (string) The name which will be used to refer to this aggregation.
bucketsPath (string?) The relative path of metric to aggregate over
Example
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('sales_per_month', 'date')
            .interval('month')
            .agg(esb.sumAggregation('sales', 'price'))
    )
    .agg(
        esb.avgBucketAggregation(
            'avg_monthly_sales',
            'sales_per_month>sales'
        )
    )
    .size(0);

DerivativeAggregation

src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/derivative-aggregation.js

A parent pipeline aggregation which calculates the derivative of a specified metric in a parent histogram (or date_histogram) aggregation. The specified metric must be numeric and the enclosing histogram must have min_doc_count set to 0 (default for histogram aggregations).

Elasticsearch reference

new DerivativeAggregation(name: string, bucketsPath: string?)

Extends PipelineAggregationBase

Parameters
name (string) The name which will be used to refer to this aggregation.
bucketsPath (string?) The relative path of metric to aggregate over
Example
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('sales_per_month', 'date')
            .interval('month')
            .agg(esb.sumAggregation('sales', 'price'))
            .agg(esb.derivativeAggregation('sales_deriv', 'sales'))
    )
    .size(0);
// First and second order derivative of the monthly sales
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('sales_per_month', 'date')
            .interval('month')
            .agg(esb.sumAggregation('sales', 'price'))
            .agg(esb.derivativeAggregation('sales_deriv', 'sales'))
            .agg(esb.derivativeAggregation('sales_2nd_deriv', 'sales_deriv'))
    )
    .size(0);
Instance Members
▸ unit(unit)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/derivative-aggregation.js

Set the units of the derivative values. unit specifies what unit to use for the x-axis of the derivative calculation

unit(unit: string): DerivativeAggregation
Parameters
unit (string) unit specifies what unit to use for the x-axis of the derivative calculation
Returns
DerivativeAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
Example
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('sales_per_month', 'date')
            .interval('month')
            .agg(esb.sumAggregation('sales', 'price'))
            .agg(esb.derivativeAggregation('sales_deriv', 'sales').unit('day'))
    )
    .size(0);

MaxBucketAggregation

src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/max-bucket-aggregation.js

A sibling pipeline aggregation which identifies the bucket(s) with the maximum value of a specified metric in a sibling aggregation and outputs both the value and the key(s) of the bucket(s). The specified metric must be numeric and the sibling aggregation must be a multi-bucket aggregation.

Elasticsearch reference

new MaxBucketAggregation(name: string, bucketsPath: string?)

Extends PipelineAggregationBase

Parameters
name (string) The name which will be used to refer to this aggregation.
bucketsPath (string?) The relative path of metric to aggregate over
Example
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('sales_per_month', 'date')
            .interval('month')
            .agg(esb.sumAggregation('sales', 'price'))
    )
    .agg(
        // Metric embedded in sibling aggregation
        // Get the maximum value of `sales` aggregation in
        // `sales_per_month` histogram
        esb.maxBucketAggregation(
            'max_monthly_sales',
            'sales_per_month>sales'
        )
    )
    .size(0);

MinBucketAggregation

src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/min-bucket-aggregation.js

A sibling pipeline aggregation which identifies the bucket(s) with the minimum value of a specified metric in a sibling aggregation and outputs both the value and the key(s) of the bucket(s). The specified metric must be numeric and the sibling aggregation must be a multi-bucket aggregation.

Elasticsearch reference

new MinBucketAggregation(name: string, bucketsPath: string?)

Extends PipelineAggregationBase

Parameters
name (string) The name which will be used to refer to this aggregation.
bucketsPath (string?) The relative path of metric to aggregate over
Example
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('sales_per_month', 'date')
            .interval('month')
            .agg(esb.sumAggregation('sales', 'price'))
    )
    .agg(
        // Metric embedded in sibling aggregation
        // Get the minimum value of `sales` aggregation in
        // `sales_per_month` histogram
        esb.minBucketAggregation(
            'min_monthly_sales',
            'sales_per_month>sales'
        )
    )
    .size(0);

SumBucketAggregation

src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/sum-bucket-aggregation.js

A sibling pipeline aggregation which calculates the sum across all bucket of a specified metric in a sibling aggregation. The specified metric must be numeric and the sibling aggregation must be a multi-bucket aggregation.

Elasticsearch reference

new SumBucketAggregation(name: string, bucketsPath: string?)

Extends PipelineAggregationBase

Parameters
name (string) The name which will be used to refer to this aggregation.
bucketsPath (string?) The relative path of metric to aggregate over
Example
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('sales_per_month', 'date')
            .interval('month')
            .agg(esb.sumAggregation('sales', 'price'))
    )
    .agg(
        // Get the sum of all the total monthly `sales` buckets
        esb.sumBucketAggregation(
            'sum_monthly_sales',
            'sales_per_month>sales'
        )
    )
    .size(0);

StatsBucketAggregation

src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/stats-bucket-aggregation.js

A sibling pipeline aggregation which calculates a variety of stats across all bucket of a specified metric in a sibling aggregation. The specified metric must be numeric and the sibling aggregation must be a multi-bucket aggregation.

Elasticsearch reference

new StatsBucketAggregation(name: string, bucketsPath: string?)

Extends PipelineAggregationBase

Parameters
name (string) The name which will be used to refer to this aggregation.
bucketsPath (string?) The relative path of metric to aggregate over
Example
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('sales_per_month', 'date')
            .interval('month')
            .agg(esb.sumAggregation('sales', 'price'))
    )
    .agg(
        // Calculates stats for monthly sales
        esb.statsBucketAggregation(
            'stats_monthly_sales',
            'sales_per_month>sales'
        )
    )
    .size(0);

ExtendedStatsBucketAggregation

src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/extended-stats-bucket-aggregation.js

A sibling pipeline aggregation which calculates a variety of stats across all bucket of a specified metric in a sibling aggregation. The specified metric must be numeric and the sibling aggregation must be a multi-bucket aggregation.

Elasticsearch reference

new ExtendedStatsBucketAggregation(name: string, bucketsPath: string?)

Extends PipelineAggregationBase

Parameters
name (string) The name which will be used to refer to this aggregation.
bucketsPath (string?) The relative path of metric to aggregate over
Example
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('sales_per_month', 'date')
            .interval('month')
            .agg(esb.sumAggregation('sales', 'price'))
    )
    .agg(
        // Calculates extended stats for monthly sales
        esb.extendedStatsBucketAggregation(
            'stats_monthly_sales',
            'sales_per_month>sales'
        )
    )
    .size(0);
Instance Members
▸ sigma(sigma)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/extended-stats-bucket-aggregation.js

Sets the number of standard deviations above/below the mean to display. Optional.

sigma(sigma: number): ExtendedStatsBucketAggregation
Parameters
sigma (number) Default is 2.
Returns
ExtendedStatsBucketAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained

PercentilesBucketAggregation

src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/percentiles-bucket-aggregation.js

A sibling pipeline aggregation which calculates percentiles across all bucket of a specified metric in a sibling aggregation. The specified metric must be numeric and the sibling aggregation must be a multi-bucket aggregation.

Elasticsearch reference

new PercentilesBucketAggregation(name: string, bucketsPath: string?)

Extends PipelineAggregationBase

Parameters
name (string) The name which will be used to refer to this aggregation.
bucketsPath (string?) The relative path of metric to aggregate over
Example
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('sales_per_month', 'date')
            .interval('month')
            .agg(esb.sumAggregation('sales', 'price'))
    )
    .agg(
        // Calculates stats for monthly sales
        esb.percentilesBucketAggregation(
            'percentiles_monthly_sales',
            'sales_per_month>sales'
        ).percents([25.0, 50.0, 75.0])
    )
    .size(0);
Instance Members
▸ percents(percents)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/percentiles-bucket-aggregation.js

Sets the list of percentiles to calculate

percents(percents: Array<number>): PercentilesBucketAggregation
Parameters
percents (Array<number>) The list of percentiles to calculate
Returns
PercentilesBucketAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained

MovingAverageAggregation

src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/moving-average-aggregation.js

Given an ordered series of data, the Moving Average aggregation will slide a window across the data and emit the average value of that window.

moving_avg aggregations must be embedded inside of a histogram or date_histogram aggregation.

Elasticsearch reference

new MovingAverageAggregation(name: string, bucketsPath: string?)

Extends PipelineAggregationBase

Parameters
name (string) The name which will be used to refer to this aggregation.
bucketsPath (string?) The relative path of metric to aggregate over
Example
const agg = esb.movingAverageAggregation('the_movavg', 'the_sum')
    .model('holt')
    .window(5)
    .gapPolicy('insert_zeros')
    .settings({ alpha: 0.8 });
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('my_date_histo', 'timestamp')
            .interval('day')
            .agg(esb.sumAggregation('the_sum', 'lemmings'))
            // Relative path to sibling metric `the_sum`
            .agg(esb.movingAverageAggregation('the_movavg', 'the_sum'))
    )
    .size(0);
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('my_date_histo', 'timestamp')
            .interval('day')
            // Use the document count as it's input
            .agg(esb.movingAverageAggregation('the_movavg', '_count'))
    )
    .size(0);
Instance Members
▸ format()
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/moving-average-aggregation.js
format()
Throws
  • Error: This method cannot be called on MovingAverageAggregation
▸ model(model)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/moving-average-aggregation.js

Sets the moving average weighting model that we wish to use. Optional.

model(model: string): MovingAverageAggregation
Parameters
model (string) Can be simple , linear , ewma (aka "single-exponential"), holt (aka "double exponential") or holt_winters (aka "triple exponential"). Default is simple
Returns
MovingAverageAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
Example
const agg = esb.movingAverageAggregation('the_movavg', 'the_sum')
    .model('simple')
    .window(30);
const agg = esb.movingAverageAggregation('the_movavg', 'the_sum')
    .model('ewma')
    .window(30)
    .settings({ alpha: 0.8 });
▸ window(window)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/moving-average-aggregation.js

Sets the size of window to "slide" across the histogram. Optional.

window(window: number): MovingAverageAggregation
Parameters
window (number) Default is 5
Returns
MovingAverageAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
Example
const agg = esb.movingAverageAggregation('the_movavg', 'the_sum')
    .model('simple')
    .window(30)
▸ minimize(enable)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/moving-average-aggregation.js

If the model should be algorithmically minimized. Optional. Applicable on EWMA, Holt-Linear, Holt-Winters. Minimization is disabled by default for ewma and holt_linear, while it is enabled by default for holt_winters.

minimize(enable: boolean): MovingAverageAggregation
Parameters
enable (boolean) false for most models
Returns
MovingAverageAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
Example
const agg = esb.movingAverageAggregation('the_movavg', 'the_sum')
    .model('holt_winters')
    .window(30)
    .minimize(true)
    .settings({ period: 7 });
▸ settings(settings)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/moving-average-aggregation.js

Model-specific settings, contents which differ depending on the model specified. Optional.

settings(settings: Object): MovingAverageAggregation
Parameters
settings (Object)
Returns
MovingAverageAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chaineds
Example
const agg = esb.movingAverageAggregation('the_movavg', 'the_sum')
    .model('ewma')
    .window(30)
    .settings({ alpha: 0.8 });
▸ predict(predict)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/moving-average-aggregation.js

Enable "prediction" mode, which will attempt to extrapolate into the future given the current smoothed, moving average

predict(predict: number): MovingAverageAggregation
Parameters
predict (number) the number of predictions you would like appended to the end of the series
Returns
MovingAverageAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
Example
const agg = esb.movingAverageAggregation('the_movavg', 'the_sum')
    .model('simple')
    .window(30)
    .predict(10);

MovingFunctionAggregation

src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/moving-function-aggregation.js

Given an ordered series of data, the Moving Function aggregation will slide a window across the data and allow the user to specify a custom script that is executed on each window of data. For convenience, a number of common functions are predefined such as min/max, moving averages, etc.

moving_fn aggregations must be embedded inside of a histogram or date_histogram aggregation.

Elasticsearch reference

NOTE: Only available in Elasticsearch 6.4.0+.

new MovingFunctionAggregation(name: string, bucketsPath: string?, window: string?, script: string?)

Extends PipelineAggregationBase

Parameters
name (string) The name which will be used to refer to this aggregation.
bucketsPath (string?) The relative path of metric to aggregate over.
window (string?) The size of window to "slide" across the histogram.
script (string?) The script that should be executed on each window of data.
Example
const agg = esb.movingFunctionAggregation('the_movfn', 'the_sum')
    .model('holt')
    .window(5)
    .gapPolicy('insert_zeros')
    .settings({ alpha: 0.8 });
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('my_date_histo', 'timestamp')
            .interval('day')
            .agg(esb.sumAggregation('the_sum', 'lemmings'))
            // Relative path to sibling metric `the_sum`
            .agg(esb.movingFunctionAggregation('the_movfn', 'the_sum'))
    )
    .size(0);
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('my_date_histo', 'timestamp')
            .interval('day')
            // Use the document count as it's input
            .agg(esb.movingFunctionAggregation('the_movfn', '_count'))
    )
    .size(0);
Instance Members
▸ window(window)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/moving-function-aggregation.js

Sets the size of window to "slide" across the histogram. Optional.

window(window: number): MovingFunctionAggregation
Parameters
window (number) Default is 5
Returns
MovingFunctionAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
Example
const agg = esb.movingFunctionAggregation('the_movfn', 'the_sum')
    .window(30)
▸ shift(shift)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/moving-function-aggregation.js

Sets shift of window position. Optional.

shift(shift: number): MovingFunctionAggregation
Parameters
shift (number) Default is 0
Returns
MovingFunctionAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
Example
const agg = esb.movingFunctionAggregation('the_movfn', 'the_sum')
    .shift(30)
▸ script(script)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/moving-function-aggregation.js

Sets the script that should be executed on each window of data. Required.

script(script: string): MovingFunctionAggregation
Parameters
script (string)
Returns
MovingFunctionAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
Example
const agg = esb.movingFunctionAggregation('the_movfn', 'the_sum', "MovingFunctions.unweightedAvg(values)"")
    .script("MovingFunctions.unweightedAvg(values)")

CumulativeSumAggregation

src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/cumulative-sum-aggregation.js

A parent pipeline aggregation which calculates the cumulative sum of a specified metric in a parent histogram (or date_histogram) aggregation. The specified metric must be numeric and the enclosing histogram must have min_doc_count set to 0 (default for histogram aggregations).

Elasticsearch reference

new CumulativeSumAggregation(name: string, bucketsPath: string?)

Extends PipelineAggregationBase

Parameters
name (string) The name which will be used to refer to this aggregation.
bucketsPath (string?) The relative path of metric to aggregate over
Example
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('sales_per_month', 'date', 'month')
            .agg(esb.sumAggregation('sales', 'price'))
            .agg(esb.cumulativeSumAggregation('cumulative_sales', 'sales'))
    )
    .size(0);
Instance Members
▸ gapPolicy()
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/cumulative-sum-aggregation.js
gapPolicy()
Throws
  • Error: This method cannot be called on CumulativeSumAggregation

BucketScriptAggregation

src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/bucket-script-aggregation.js

A parent pipeline aggregation which executes a script which can perform per bucket computations on specified metrics in the parent multi-bucket aggregation. The specified metric must be numeric and the script must return a numeric value.

Elasticsearch reference

new BucketScriptAggregation(name: string, bucketsPath: string?)

Extends PipelineAggregationBase

Parameters
name (string) The name which will be used to refer to this aggregation.
bucketsPath (string?) The relative path of metric to aggregate over
Example
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('sales_per_month', 'date', 'month')
            .agg(esb.sumAggregation('total_sales', 'price'))
            .agg(
                esb.filterAggregation('t-shirts')
                    .filter(esb.termQuery('type', 't-shirt'))
                    .agg(esb.sumAggregation('sales', 'price'))
            )
            .agg(
                esb.bucketScriptAggregation('t-shirt-percentage')
                    .bucketsPath({
                        tShirtSales: 't-shirts>sales',
                        totalSales: 'total_sales'
                    })
                    .script('params.tShirtSales / params.totalSales * 100')
            )
    )
    .size(0);
Instance Members
▸ script(script)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/bucket-script-aggregation.js

Sets script parameter for aggregation.

script(script: (Script | string)): BucketScriptAggregation
Parameters
script ((Script | string))
Returns
BucketScriptAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
Throws
  • TypeError: If script is not an instance of Script

BucketSelectorAggregation

src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/bucket-selector-aggregation.js

A parent pipeline aggregation which executes a script which determines whether the current bucket will be retained in the parent multi-bucket aggregation. The specified metric must be numeric and the script must return a boolean value. If the script language is expression then a numeric return value is permitted. In this case 0.0 will be evaluated as false and all other values will evaluate to true.

Elasticsearch reference

new BucketSelectorAggregation(name: string, bucketsPath: string?)

Extends PipelineAggregationBase

Parameters
name (string) The name which will be used to refer to this aggregation.
bucketsPath (string?) The relative path of metric to aggregate over
Example
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('histo', 'date')
            .interval('day')
            .agg(esb.termsAggregation('categories', 'category'))
            .agg(
                esb.bucketSelectorAggregation('min_bucket_selector')
                    .bucketsPath({ count: 'categories._bucket_count' })
                    .script(esb.script('inline', 'params.count != 0'))
            )
    )
    .size(0);
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('sales_per_month', 'date')
            .interval('month')
            .agg(esb.sumAggregation('sales', 'price'))
            .agg(
                esb.bucketSelectorAggregation('sales_bucket_filter')
                    .bucketsPath({ totalSales: 'total_sales' })
                    .script('params.totalSales > 200')
            )
    )
    .size(0);
Instance Members
▸ format()
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/bucket-selector-aggregation.js
format()
Throws
  • Error: This method cannot be called on BucketSelectorAggregation
▸ script(script)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/bucket-selector-aggregation.js

Sets script parameter for aggregation. Required.

script(script: (Script | string)): BucketSelectorAggregation
Parameters
script ((Script | string))
Returns
BucketSelectorAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
Throws
  • TypeError: If script is not an instance of Script

SerialDifferencingAggregation

src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/serial-differencing-aggregation.js

Serial differencing is a technique where values in a time series are subtracted from itself at different time lags or periods.

Serial differences are built by first specifying a histogram or date_histogram over a field.

Elasticsearch reference

new SerialDifferencingAggregation(name: string, bucketsPath: string?)

Extends PipelineAggregationBase

Parameters
name (string) The name which will be used to refer to this aggregation.
bucketsPath (string?) The relative path of metric to aggregate over
Example
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.dateHistogramAggregation('my_date_histo', 'timestamp')
            .interval('day')
            .agg(esb.sumAggregation('the_sum', 'lemmings'))
            .agg(
                esb.serialDifferencingAggregation(
                    'thirtieth_difference',
                    'the_sum'
                ).lag(30)
            )
    )
    .size(0);
Instance Members
▸ lag(lag)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/serial-differencing-aggregation.js

The historical bucket to subtract from the current value. Optional.

lag(lag: number): SerialDifferencingAggregation
Parameters
lag (number) Default is 1.
Returns
SerialDifferencingAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained

BucketSortAggregation

src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/bucket-sort-aggregation.js

A parent pipeline aggregation which sorts the buckets of its parent multi-bucket aggregation. Zero or more sort fields may be specified together with the corresponding sort order. Each bucket may be sorted based on its _key, _count or its sub-aggregations. In addition, parameters from and size may be set in order to truncate the result buckets.

Elasticsearch reference

new BucketSortAggregation(name: string)

Extends PipelineAggregationBase

Parameters
name (string) The name which will be used to refer to this aggregation.
Example
const reqBody = esb.requestBodySearch()
    .agg(
        esb.bucketSortAggregation('sort')
            .sort([
                 esb.sort('user', 'desc')
             ])
             .from(5)
             .size(10)
        )
    );
Instance Members
▸ sort(sort)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/bucket-sort-aggregation.js

Sets the list of fields to sort on. Optional.

sort(sort: Array<Sort>): BucketSortAggregation
Parameters
sort (Array<Sort>) The list of fields to sort on
Returns
BucketSortAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ from(from)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/bucket-sort-aggregation.js

Sets the value buckets in positions prior to which will be truncated. Optional.

from(from: number): BucketSortAggregation
Parameters
from (number) Buckets in positions prior to the set value will be truncated.
Returns
BucketSortAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ size(size)
src/aggregations/pipeline-aggregations/bucket-sort-aggregation.js

Sets the number of buckets to return. Optional.

size(size: number): BucketSortAggregation
Parameters
size (number) The number of buckets to return.
Returns
BucketSortAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained

Matrix Aggregations

Matrix Aggregations

MatrixStatsAggregation

src/aggregations/matrix-aggregations/matrix-stats-aggregation.js

The matrix_stats aggregation is a numeric aggregation that computes statistics over a set of document fields

Elasticsearch reference

new MatrixStatsAggregation(name: string, fields: Array?)

Extends Aggregation

Parameters
name (string) A valid aggregation name
fields (Array?) Array of fields
Example
const agg = esb.matrixStatsAggregation('matrixstats', ['poverty', 'income']);
Instance Members
▸ fields(fields)
src/aggregations/matrix-aggregations/matrix-stats-aggregation.js

The fields setting defines the set of fields (as an array) for computing the statistics.

fields(fields: Array<string>): MatrixStatsAggregation
Parameters
fields (Array<string>) Array of fields
Returns
MatrixStatsAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
Example
const agg = esb.matrixStatsAggregation('matrixstats')
    .fields(['poverty', 'income']);
▸ mode(mode)
src/aggregations/matrix-aggregations/matrix-stats-aggregation.js

The mode parameter controls what array value the aggregation will use for array or multi-valued fields

mode(mode: string): MatrixStatsAggregation
Parameters
mode (string) One of avg , min , max , sum and median
Returns
MatrixStatsAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
▸ missing(missing)
src/aggregations/matrix-aggregations/matrix-stats-aggregation.js

The missing parameter defines how documents that are missing a value should be treated. By default they will be ignored but it is also possible to treat them as if they had a value.

missing(missing: Object): MatrixStatsAggregation
Parameters
missing (Object) Set of fieldname : value mappings to specify default values per field
Returns
MatrixStatsAggregation: returns this so that calls can be chained
Example
const agg = esb.matrixStatsAggregation('matrixstats')
    .fields(['poverty', 'income'])
    .missing({ income: 50000 });

Score Functions

Score Functions

ScoreFunction

src/queries/compound-queries/score-functions/score-function.js

ScoreFunction provides support for common options used across various ScoreFunction implementations.

Elasticsearch reference

NOTE: Instantiating this directly should not be required. However, if you wish to add a custom implementation for whatever reason, this class could be extended.

new ScoreFunction(name: string)
Parameters
name (string)
Instance Members
▸ filter(filterQry)
src/queries/compound-queries/score-functions/score-function.js

Adds a filter query whose matching documents will have the score function applied.

filter(filterQry: Query): ScoreFunction
Parameters
filterQry (Query) A valid Query object.
Returns
ScoreFunction: returns this so that calls can be chained.
▸ weight(weight)
src/queries/compound-queries/score-functions/score-function.js

Sets the weight of the score function

weight(weight: number): ScoreFunction
Parameters
weight (number) The weight of this score function.
Returns
ScoreFunction: returns this so that calls can be chained.
